intro: Sparganium emersum subsp. simplex, commonly known as the narrowleaf bur reed, is a flowering plant in the family Typhaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that often grow in shallow water or damp soil. The plant produces distinctive, spiky, yellowish-green flower heads that are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, typically arranged in two rows along the stem. This subspecies is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes.
